intro: Phlegmariurus nanus, commonly known as the small thong moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. The plant has a thallus that is prostrate and forms dense mats, with leaf-like structures arranged in a distinctive thong-like pattern. It lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having a simple structure composed of a central axis and lateral branches. Phlegmariurus nanus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
